title: Free Universal Pre-K Program Launches In NYC
teaser: Mayor Bill DeBlasio's program commences today with tens of thousands of 4-year-olds heading to more than 1,700 sites across the city.
contentencoded:
It’s the first day of school for more than a million students, as New York City schools are back in session today.

But there is a new crop of youngsters donning backpacks and school uniforms, as Mayor Bill DeBlasio’s new free universal pre-kindergarten program commences. Tens of thousands of 4-year-olds will head to more than 1,700 sites across the city to begin their academic careers.

Here & Now’s Robin Young speaks with Sarah Darville, bureau chief for Chalkbeat New York, an online educational news organization in New York, about the mayor’s pre-K rollout.

Guest

  • Sarah Darville, bureau chief for Chalkbeat New York, a news site covering educational change in New York schools. She tweets @sarahdarv.
